subject: Re: [junit] unknows AssertError and feature request
msgSnippet: Hi Gott ... With JUnit you have the option to include a String describing the assertion when you construct it, eg: assertEquals( MethodX should find only one
messageBody:
Hi Gott

> First of all I have a problem with an error msg.
>
>>>>java.lang.AssertError: expected: <1> but was: <2>
>
> Now I known that belongs to the number of contructors. But it was a
> very long way to get this solution. May it could be more infomational,
> please.

With JUnit you have the option to include a String describing the
assertion when you construct it, eg:

assertEquals("MethodX should find only one element", 1, X.countElements());

In JUnit 3 the String was optional and I'm guessing that it is optional
in JUnit 4 as well and that you've left it out.

>
> Secound: I use parameters annotation for for loading different configs
> for multiple test runs. But when the tests are run I only see a list
> of the tested methode but no parameters or something like that.
> In this case I only knows that there was an error in test No 25, e.g.,
> but I don't known why. I can not see the current input of test No 25.
>
> Is there a solution? How I can see more information in the conclusion
> of the test runs?

Can't help on that one, sorry.

Tim
